alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Morris; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 5:26PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Hunterdon, southwestern Morris and north central Somerset Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 525 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Beatyestown, or 18 miles northwest of Somerville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Morristown, Morris Plains, Mendham, Peapack And Gladstone, Chester, Far Hills, Basking Ridge, Long Valley, Succasunna-Kenvil, Beatyestown and Bernardsville. This includes Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 28 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
